definitions.definition: wrong, not suitable, or not as expected:
examples: I could see by the look on their faces that something was amiss.

definitions.definition: If something might/would not go amiss, it would be useful and might help to improve a situation:
examples: A word of apology might not go amiss.

definitions.definition: to be offended by something that someone has said to you:
examples: I was worried that he might take my remark amiss.
